column4: new Ubuntu [Linux]  user here ... need to ask question about changing my keyboard from USB to regular PS2 can anyone help? ... please
new Ubuntu [Linux]  user here ... need to change my keyboard from USB to regular PS2 can anyone help? Trying but don't know how ... please
I have looked in forums, but they explain about keyboard mappings
the only way that I am sure the problem is going to be fixed is if I reinstall Ubuntu
but I am sure there must be an easier way
I'd presume that it would be fine if you just plugged in the ps/2 mouse in now, and disconnected the usb one.
does the actual keyboard definitely work?
ok, then just reconfigure your X and specify that you're using a ps/2 keyboard, then restart x
I'm not sure if it asks on the dpkg-reconfigure. But you can definitely just edit it manually.
make your keyboard section look a bit like this: http://pastebin.com/609127
obviously you might want a different XkbLayout/Variant. Mine there is set to GB keyboard.
heh, silly me. I forget to tell you the file was /etc/X11/xorg.conf
after you've edited it, make sure you save it and then ctrl+alt+backspace and plug in the new keyboard.
not sure if it would, yes.
I thought you said that computer definitely worked with that keyboard?
try pressing ctrl+alt+1 and then plugging in the new keyboard. It should work, I'd think.
